website_summaries.verdict: This mountaineering tent can withstand strong winds and works well for long stretches.
pros: Whether you're looking for a tent that can hold up in rain or wind or just a reliable 4-person tent, this is a reasonably priced option that sets up quickly
While it is a bit on the smaller side, the peace of mind of the sturdy fiberglass poles and waterproof fly make up for the size
cons: Some customers had issues with the design of the rainfly

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the price but I had some issues.
customer_reviews.text: The rainfly strap broke on our first trip with it. It was very nicely sized for my 3 person family and the gear loft is very nice. Its a little on the heavy side for backpacking but for the size the weight wasn't awful. It rained on our trip the tent kept the moisture out but the rain fly was damp and water didn't seem to bead off the way something really waterproof does. I think this tent would be awesome if it was used for car camping but backpacking its not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Tiggie Fliggins

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I had borrowed a tent from a friend for my first camping adventure and loved the tent, but wasn’t willing to spend $400+. This had all the features of that more expensive tent (easy to set-up, without having to poke poles through guide pockets; two doors; storage pockets inside) but at a much more manageable price. The fly comes all the way down to the ground, which will be a good thing if/when I get caught in the rain, and forms a reasonable sized vestibule (good enough to shield shoes....). It’s what I wanted at a price point I was willing to spend.
customer_reviews.author: PC654

customer_reviews.title: The Straight Dope
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a bargain. First of all, the tent arrived here in Minneapolis a few days earlier than expected. Second, there are only two poles and set up is a snap. I set it up in the yard before my first use to gain familiarity but had to set up in the dark at the camp site, very easy! They don't give guy lines or stakes for the side pull outs, however. Inside, there is plenty of room for a queen size air mattress and space for gear. The tent also comes with a gear loft and two side wall pockets which are quite handy. Very waterproof during a 30 minute downpour with plenty of ventilation. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schnell

customer_reviews.title: Best value for a good tent.
customer_reviews.text: I shopped for quite a while before settling on the ALPS Lynx 4. It had everything that I wanted in a good 3-season tent; aluminum poles, easy set-up, tub floor, 2 doors, good ventilation, room for 2 cots, decent head space, modest colors, stays put in wind, and it's water resistant. All for a great price. Should do me a great job for years.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I’m very glad I bought this. I don’t think the price was unreasonable but it doesn’t do anything super special. I don’t like that the top mesh doesn’t have a cover because I’m paranoid someone is watching me while I sleep but it breathes very well. It is very spacious for 2 people but I wouldn’t put more than 3 in there to stay comfortable. My favorite part is that it has a door on opposite ends of the tent. It was easy to set up but hard to fit back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kal Parso

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: We used this tent extensively during our recent roadtrip. Overall, we're pretty pleased with it. Surprisingly roomy, although more like a 3-person tent than the advertised 4-person. Very easy to setup, and packs into a light and compact bag. Rained one night, and the rain hood kept us completely dry. The one quibble: not a lot of privacy without the rain hood, with the large mesh sides of the tent. Fortunately the rainhood has ventilation slots, so we didn't feel hot with the hood on. Great tent overall, worth the higher cost.
customer_reviews.author: Tiago R. Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Best 4-person backpacking tent in its class.
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR: For the price point, it is the lightest and highest quality in its class as a backpacking/camping tent. Pros: - Effective rain fly - Two entrances mean no stumbling over your partner(s) - Side and roof pouches to hold stuff - Fairly simple setup even for one person - Very lightweight - Toasty in 30-40F range (if you have the right sleeping bag) - Outer vestibule good for storing stuff - Spacious: I thought it would be a little tight because it was a backpacking tent, but it fits three people quite comfortably Cons: - No place to hang a small lantern or flashlight overhead - Outer vestibule only useful in dry conditions
customer_reviews.author: dct

customer_reviews.title: Good Tent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent, for backpacking and camping with my kids. However, it's pretty heavy for backpacking unless you split up the fly, tent, stakes, and poles between multiple people. I prefer it for 3 people w/ gear, but 4 will fit if you're friends, albeit maybe not with much gear. I haven't used it long enough to judge its' durability, but it came with some extra fabric, so I am happy to be able to DIY repair it if something happens. I've only tested it in light rain, but it did fine in 5-6 hours of drizzle.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy family setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for cub scouts and it does a great job of housing mom, dad, and two kids for an evening. It's snug with four people but not too bad. I really like the ease of setup associated with this tent. I performed a first time setup in a couple minutes with no problems. Great tent, great price!
customer_reviews.author: Hopkins_Geek

customer_reviews.title: alps dome tent
customer_reviews.text: very easy to put up. rain fly is of real decent thickness to keep out rain and keep heat in. havent actually camped in it yet but i am sure it will work fine. we wanted the aluminum poles which this tent comes with. done with fiberglass poles as they break to easy. for the price i dont think one can go wrong. to us its really a two MAYBE three person tent. by the time you add your gear thats the fourth person right there. if we can get five seasons or more i will be alright with that.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: It comes with rain!
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of reviews and was really impressed by how people said it fared well in the rain. Sure enough, we got an isolated thunderstorm right on top of us the first night. Not a single drop inside and because the way the exterior fly is attached, I didn't need to worry about bumping the sides. The vestibules were big enough to keep our shoes dry, too. This was a great purchase! PS - I bought a generic 8x10 tarp to set this on and now the tarp provides a floor for the vestibule and keeps some grass, etc out, too.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Quality tent
customer_reviews.text: We used this tent for a family car camping trip. It had plenty of room for 2 adults and a child and should fit 4 people. It assembled quickly. It's waterproof- with easy steps and quality poles, stakes, rainfly, etc. There was heavy rain the first night, and we stayed dry and cozy. A very good value in comparison to REI tents that are about twice the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. W

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the price, I'm not in love with it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a 15 year old alps mountaineering tent that is slightly smaller, and I really liked the quality. This one does not have the same quality. It's fine, and does all it is supposed to do, but, I will say, if my first alps mountaineering tent material was as thin as this one, and only 4 poles instead of 5, I wouldn't have stayed loyal to the brand. Next tent I'll probably try something else.
customer_reviews.author: bigbusyfamily

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: I rate this tent at a 4 just because one fo the outer shell guide cord anchors on the tent itself ripped off the tent. Outside of that this is an Excellent tent. I am 6'3" 250lbs. I slept with a XLSleeping mat and I had plenty of room for my things and to maneuver around without feeling confined. You need to get a tarp or water resistant flooring to sure up this tents waterproofing. It did rain but not a drop of water came into the tent. The ventilation was okay but it was an over night stay and it was not hot.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, well made, full fly
customer_reviews.text: The full rain fly is one of the reasons I boight it. I put it to the test when camping in moderate wind. The tiedowns and full fly made it bearable and the tent held up well to the wind abuse. It is pretty lightweight. I am used to cheaper tents and fiberglass poles and there is a noticable difference here.
customer_reviews.author: dstick

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! I have a 2-man REI tent that's more than double the price and can hardly tell the difference in quality between this ALPS and the REI. Good weigh for a 4-man (especially since daddy get's to carry it) and unbelievably easy to erect and break down. Beats the Morada and Taurus in that it has much more ventilation and two good-sized vestibules (enough to store all 4 packs and boots).
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great three-season tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great three-season tent for the money. I already had the one-person version of this tent, and the quality of poles, zippers and stitching convinced me that this was a good choice in a larger model. I've been very happy with it and will readily buy more products from this company. Although a few dollars more, this model with aluminum poles is lighter weight and I will assume more durable than other fiberglass pole tents I've owned in the past. All the tents I have now came with aluminum poles. I just got tired of replacing broken and fraying fiberglass pole sections.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Whitmire

customer_reviews.title: Dry during heavy rain and wind
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tent now a few times. Most recently on Boy Scout trip with heavy rain and wind (30 mph +). We were very dry. The tent will fit 3 adults. More than that its a bit cozy. The rain fly extends over both entrances which provides an area to leave stinky boots. Not a drip of rain has penetrated the rain fly. Folds up nicely to attach to my backpack. Easy to set up - two poles criss cross and the hooks seem sturdy. The only potential negative is on a hot day if using the rain fly probably a bit warm inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I’ve ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I am a avid camper and backpacker. I have used this tent about 14 times over the winter and spring. This tent has seen very heavy wet snowfall and days of straight rain and gusty wind. Not 1 drop of rain has made its way in. I am very impressed with this tents waterproofing and design. I have used and abused this tent backpacking. It’s not to heavy to backpack. I highly recommend this durable lightweight waterproof tent.
customer_reviews.author: Nick wood

customer_reviews.title: Alps Mountain 4 person tent 32 season
customer_reviews.text: I need a tent that was lightweight and easy to set up for my Off road trips. It is easy to set up even with just one person, It is not a 4 person tent you'd be lucky to get two people and their sleeping bags in their. Other than the cramped space it's fine for just me and the dog.
customer_reviews.author: DevilDog 3/7

customer_reviews.title: Great value, solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Really perfect for 2 people with a lot of gear. No problems with any leakage. Easy to put up and take down, and more importantly, to get back in the original bag. I recommend you buy heavy duty stakes (steel) if you're going to be in a high wind environment. The aluminum ones just don't hold up, and bend easily. If you get the steel spikes, invest just a little more in one of the good stake hammers. They don't weigh much and are much easier than finding an appropriate rock.
customer_reviews.author: Carl R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Solid tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice tent for the price. Seems durable and it’s dead simple to set up. Stayed dry in an overnight downpour but rain fly vents could be designed better. Water soaked the Velcro and started dripping through the mesh above. We managed to figure that out pretty quick and managed it but kind of a poor design to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan_H

customer_reviews.title: and snow (not a good weekend) It was warm
customer_reviews.text: So.....we took this tent up to the mountains in North Carolina. This thing survived freezing cold, thunderstorms, and snow (not a good weekend) It was warm, well made, and held up great. We had no leaks from the rain at all. This is a great tent for the price, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: amazonchik

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy for 1 person to set up. Held up to multiple days of heavy rain. Will need a small fan inside the tent during very hot days, did get a little stuffy. The floor of the tent is a little thicker and held up very well. Have bought over 10 tents in 20+ years, this ranks as one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Strong great tent warm vestibule is great withstood tornado.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for my two sons and I to sleep in. Figured it would be something fun for them they are four and eight. With the COVID-19 virus they are stir crazy. Set up in the yard. The other night we had a small micro burst or tornado go through my neighborhood. Over 50 mph winds uprooted trees around me, snapped telephone poles, ripped off shingles etc. Tent didn’t move in my yard. Aluminum poles very strong Easy set up too.
customer_reviews.author: JUSTIN V.

customer_reviews.title: Great in Rain
customer_reviews.text: This is a well designed tent. It is a bit too heavy for backpacking, but you can divide up pieces between people to reduce weight burden(main tent, rain fly, poles). The thing that gets this to a five star is the waterproof factor. We had a deluge of rain that had the tent submerged in 3 inches of water in a stream. After the rain, the tent was literally bone dry inside. I expected at least some dampness. So, kudos to Alps Mountaineering for a great tub basin floor design!
customer_reviews.author: Rayne

customer_reviews.title: Sets Up In 5 Minutes
customer_reviews.text: I can set this tent up in under 5 minutes by myself. And I'm not generally good at setting up tents. I'm used to the types with push up poles that are really big, but when my kids went from cub scouts to boy scouts and I was alone in the tent I decided to try something that I can carry without grunting... This tent fits the bill and works really well!
customer_reviews.author: B. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: So easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! It only takes a few minutes to assemble and it's lightweight. The two doors and vestibules are so nice. We haven't tested it in rain yet. Lots of nifty features for keeping it stable in windy conditions. The 4 man tent could definitely sleep 4 adults without stacking on top of each other (might be a little crowded, but it would be great for backpacking).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Great service!
customer_reviews.text: So much for your money! Used it for camping and backpacking. 3 people is certainly more comfortable than 4 but it will take 4. Easy setup. Had a pole break but they shipped another one free 2 years after we bought it. Got to talk to a real human being right away. We buy all our tents from ALPS.
customer_reviews.author: Liesl Herlephilothea

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum poles are a game-changer
customer_reviews.text: I love the poles, aluminum, and I love the fact that you just form them as an X, tuck the poles into each corner, and clip the tent to the poles. This is one of the easiest to set up tents I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast shipping and we didn't even pay for it! Awesome tent!!! Roomy enough for a family of four with roomy vestibules on two sides. We set it up in the living room in minutes and are looking forward to hitting the trail! After the trail- Still an awesome tent. Sets up fast and you can distribute the poles and tent pieces amongst the group for easier carrying. It can get too hot with 4 people but thanks to the vestibules, you can open the doors for extra venting.
customer_reviews.author: WWI Flying Ace

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We took this to Summit lake in Colorado. It was at 10,000 ft elevation and the overnight temp dropped to the 30s. We never felt the wind or the cold. It was amazing!
customer_reviews.author: The Trok Family

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. First night out had massive storm
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. First night out had massive storm. Only a little water in that was my fault as i didn't have the rain fly set up optimally. Have had three nights now without a problem. Set up very easy. Permanent instructions are attached to carrying bag. Wish the manufacture had instructions or You Tube video on how to fold and clean tent. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: AHappyAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good for three of us.
customer_reviews.text: It has been a good tent so far. I've only used it with 3 of us in it. If we had four in there, the space would get right in a hurry. Only flaw was a stitched loop for hooking on the overhead storage net was not stitched properly. It was fine because I hang a lantern from top loop instead of using the storage net. Sets up and tears down really easily and quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Martin

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a tent! I’ve only used it once but it performed well. Plenty of room for me the boyfriend and our dog. I liked all the mesh for star gazing at night and having doors on both sides is AMAZING. looking forward to doing more camping.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis A

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time on a desert camping trip this weekend. Quick and easy to set up. Good room for two adults, or plus one child after his $20 cheapy tent’s door zipper blew out. As it was a warm and dry weekend, was able to use it without the rain fly... great star viewing through the mesh top (walls have solid fabric high enough that you still have some privacy)... but unable to comment on the rain resistancy of the product at this time. Feels pretty solid, I particularly like the aluminum poles. I will probably buy the two-person version of this to replace my son’s tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: One of the nicest tents I have ever used. My son started boy scouts this year and they camp 13 times a year so I decided to upgrade tents. For the money you won’t beat this. It’s as good as some of the $400 REI tents out there. Even has aluminum poles. Definitely need the floor tarp to go with it but this is a great buy. Even packs up and fits in the bag easily.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This product was defective out of the box. We bought it in July but didn't use it until Labor Day so it was past the Amazon return window. The top loop wasn't sewn into the roof properly and pulled out before we were able to hook it to the poles. Several other seams were poorly sewn. How do I get a refund?
customer_reviews.author: heddy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I spend at least a week every September in the mountains of Colorado in a tent. I just up sized from a 2 person to this 4 person. This allowed me to use a cot and keep all my gear in the dry. The last week I spent included temps down to 20, some rain and gusty winds. The tent performed great. This is my 3rd personal tent I have bought and it is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Great Design and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, good interior space for a couple of people with their gear (2 cots would even fit comfortably). I also like the vestibules that provide storage on both ends of the tent, outside of the screen but inside the rain fly which is perfect for shoes and other dirty items that need cover.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: ALPS = best tents ever
customer_reviews.text: Best tents ever for car camping! We camp nearly ever weekend in the spring and fall rock climbing seasons. These tents are tops! Free standing. Only two poles with no ridiculous pole configurations. No fuss means the tent can be pitched by one person in a flash. It has a great rainfly that keeps us dry. I have two high end tents that rarely get used. I had this model in a two person and it was my go-to tent. But then the family grew and we went for this one. Another great purchase from ALPS mountaineering!
customer_reviews.author: KSS

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Plenty of Space
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent for a music festival and loved it! Fly protected us very well from the rain. Well-ventilated if fly is taken off. We had been using a two-person tent for the festival, and it was just a bit too small. This 4-person tent was perfect for us and our things to fit into. Easy to put together, and it's also quite lightweight! Tempted to bring it along if we go on a backpacking trip with friends in the future. Plenty of space and quite lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great little tent
customer_reviews.text: What a great little tent! Just back from my second outing with it and I am in love with the utility and quality. Set up is intuitive and quick. It held up beautifully in winds that collapsed my neighbor’s tent!
customer_reviews.author: Wiselady3

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We took this tent backpacking and it worked out great. Light enough and fit our family of four just fine. I really liked the mess roof for stargazing at night.
customer_reviews.author: Stone Family

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty tent! Awesome value!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I set it up my cat proceeded to climb up the tent under the rain cover. Even his super sharp claws did not hurt this mighty little tent. The poles are larger gauge than I was expecting a made of really solid feeling aluminum. It also has a little mesh hanging thing inside to hold your stuff. Goes up nice and easy and looks good too! Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: doug sisk

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. There were a few loose threads when I first set it up. I have used it through several heavy rain storms and it held up very well. I would buy this product again and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this tent is easily assembled. I prefer not having pole sleeves as ...
customer_reviews.text: this tent is easily assembled. I prefer not having pole sleeves as in this construction. While it's a 3 season I think I'd prefer the kelty modifications so that I could get a little more air in the summer. Needs a groundsheet.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Gummy BearTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent for the value!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is HUGE!! I was expecting it to be smaller, based on my other ALPS tent, the Mystique 2.0(billed as a 2 man, but more like 1.5 man). I love the Lynx! I am 6ft and can definitely move around and have enough room for my gear! The only complaint that I have is with the vestibule. The zipper for the door is quite high up under the rain flye and is hard to reach. I also with the vestibule was little bit deeper. Otherwise, its a great tent, I have used 4 times already this year and will continue to do so!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent!
customer_reviews.text: Served our needs - I do wish it had a skylight but for the price it met our needs. The windows are fairly open so you do need the fly for privacy. Easy to set up and break down.
customer_reviews.author: cdk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great, well built tent that's easy on your wallet. Made in my home state (or so they say) and works well in rain. Quality product, sturdy aluminum poles and stakes, I just wish the footprint was included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, it works, but it is a very warm tent.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, not lightweight, very warm, lacks breath ability, good for colder climates... i lice in the tropics, due to the construction it doesmt allow for a breeze to hit you while in the tent. Overall great construction, super easy to use, well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rule

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent. Best tent I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing! This is my wife and I's first "nice" tent. It has more mesh than some of the other models which allows for better air flow; this means less stuffy nights in the warmer months. I recommend buying the "AL" version that comes with aluminum tent poles which are a bit more durable. This tent does not come with the footprint, but you can buy a tarp from most stores for cheap that works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark&Erin

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that it will comfortable sleep 2 people
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tent for over 15 camping trips in the past 2 months in New Mexico and Arizona. Holds up well with wind and rain. My only complaint is that it will comfortable sleep 2 people. I use a full-size air mattress and there is enough room for other things but it would be crowded with another person. The ventilation is good esp. in the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Spierling

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-range priced tent
customer_reviews.text: . After using the tent around four or five times both poles bent, I had a little wind taking down my tent the tent rolled bending both poles I'll write more after I hear from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smice

customer_reviews.title: great tent for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for a couple days camping in the Mountains in Montana, could not be happier with my purchase, tent is super quick to set up, under 5 minutes, and take down is a breeze, tent performed well, it was windy and cold and it held up great, I would add some paracord to the zippers, makes them easier to find, but that is about all the modifications I have done so far. Going camping again this weekend, it might bring a little rain, but I know this tent will handle it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris DeMars

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son who is a Boy Scout. First campout and it rained and was windy. Not a drop of water in the tent and it stood strong. We have only used it once. We did put a tarp down first to keep things clean. So far a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Love it, great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the tents that we have had in the last few years this one definitely is the best and easiest to put up.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Zewe

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Went camping in 65 mile per hour winds and the tent held up like a champ. So many other tents around us had snapped poles. Easy to assemble too.
customer_reviews.author: Mundo

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control. Bungy cord in both pole sets cut in multiple places making them useless. Pole ends were bent. Bottom of pole bag torn out. Tent had holes, from shipping with lose poles. Very disappointed with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Worked as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as intended. Wish the little side windows had a way to cover them at night to prevent people watching you while you're asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D.

customer_reviews.title: Light and very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This tent holds up well with rain, dries fast, and has two doors for great access. I can set it up and take it down by myself. This summer I anticipate taking it backpacking because it's so light--I'll update my review to reflect that experience.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: i love it, but gave it a 4 stars because my son got the zipper stuck the first night, and i can't get it undone. VERY easy to put up and take down. roomy for 1 adult 2 small kids.
customer_reviews.author: yet

customer_reviews.title: Rain fly doesn’t withstand folding and storing in tent bag overtime.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this one time and just took it out to use again and the clear part on the rain fly are all cracked which rain will get through now and just from storing. Unfortunately if it rains we are out of luck. The tent has been stored indoors. Unfortunately I bought to withstand rain storms but didn’t foresee this happening.
customer_reviews.author: Sariah Agers

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. First time I used it it poured and flooded the campsite. The bottom of the tent felt like a water bed and yet I was dry. A queen size air mattress takes up a little over half the floor space of the tent so it is perfect for 2 people and a bunch of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. It's now my favorite one. I camp alone a good bit and this is way more than enough room for me of course, but when I bring along a friend there is still plenty of room for us and our things. I can put it up on my own in less than 10 minutes. I've never actually timed myself, but I think that's pretty accurate. It has stood up to a wind storm that blew quite a few other tents apart. It also went through 12 hours of steady rain without any leaks. I love the vestibules on each side. Highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: We love our new ALPS tent. Easy to setup and meeting all our expectations.
customer_reviews.text: We love our new ALPS tent. Easy to setup and meeting all our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Tadek

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We use this for backyard camping and backpacking. I've been camping and backpacking for 25 years and this tent is just as good as the big name brands without the big brand price. It's roomy enough for my two sons and me (all of us are over 6' tall) and our gear. It can sleep 4 comfortably. The two huge doors and open mesh top provide plenty of ventilation. Easy, quick set up and tear down.
customer_reviews.author: Adair

customer_reviews.title: Betr
customer_reviews.text: Kept us warm and dry in 20 degree weather. I like the full fly. Our last alps tent had a little plastic window on the fly that cracked, this one does not have the window and the tent poles are lighter.
customer_reviews.author: sammy mull

customer_reviews.title: Good for Car Camping, not sure about backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent car camping. It was easy to set up. I fit a queen and a twin air mattress inside, with not much room left over. The net organizer was a nice touch. I'm not sure If I'd take this backpacking, as it's a bit heavy to lug up and down mountains all day. All in all a good tent for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Vera

customer_reviews.title: Would happily buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent several years ago and I have never regretted that decision. It’s held up great to rain and sun. I truly could not be happier with it. It’s a little heavy for backpacking, but if you split it up between multiple hikers it’s not bad.
customer_reviews.author: A Captured Imagination

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a killer tent
customer_reviews.text: My second Alps tent and 4 major piece of Alps gear. This tent has held up so far just as well as my 9 year old Alps tent. Great price for a killer tent. Fits my queen air mattress with 3 feet on the bottom and 2 feet or more on each side.
customer_reviews.author: Margeaux Macchiaverna

customer_reviews.title: Water proof thank goodness
customer_reviews.text: Tent was water proof when it rained. That's always good. I don't really know how durable it is since I just used it for a week last summer. It was nice to have a tent that was dry for a change.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from New Haven

customer_reviews.title: I love the interior height and it's easy setup
customer_reviews.text: For the price vs. size vs. quality, this tent is it. I love the interior height and it's easy setup. I just bought a small 5' x 7' tarp from Harbor Freight to use as the foot print. I did not like the large nylon bag that came with it to pack it in. It's too large and not conducive to attach to my hiking backpack. So I just ordered a smaller nylon compression bag to put it all in. The tent itself is perfect as a backpacking tent with palatial room. It is good quality and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Z

customer_reviews.title: easy, fast set up.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy and fast to set up. Roomy and nice cover for outside tent space. Well made. Works really well for 2 people but 4 have slept in it comfortably.It kept the rain out.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to assemble and it is really water resistant. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Siqi Wang

customer_reviews.title: but will holdup better in bad weather
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my son who does weekend backpacking trips. This tent is made very well and has plenty of room for 4. It's a bit heavier than most 2 person tents, but will holdup better in bad weather. Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a bad Wakeman and holy cow the difference is huge. Very roomy, easy to set up, looks sleek, and feels like great material. Especially the outer covering, feel like we could take on a storm... not that we want to!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight spacious tent! Durable true 3-season
customer_reviews.text: Nice 3-season 4-person Lightweight tent! Weight the same as older 2-person model we have. Easy to set up, durable. Well weather protected. We managed to fit in 2 unduly s and 3 kids with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail N Slipchenko

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, outstanding customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've used an ALPS Mountaineering Extreme 3 for years and like it, so when I needed a slightly bigger tent, the Lynx-4 was an easy choice. The tent was delivered on schedule, but when I opened it up, there was some crusty white powder on the tent body. I emailed ALPS customer service and within a week I had a brand new (clean) tent body free of charge. 5 stars for both the tent itself and for ALPS' outstanding customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Camping
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very easy to set up. Very roomy for my grandson and myself on Boy Scout camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I like it- chose 4 person but the 3 was going to be fine for us, my wife, our 6 years old and I. Wanted a little bit extra room for the backpacks, I realized that a 3 person model was enough.
customer_reviews.author: domingo perez

customer_reviews.title: I love the vestibules and double door
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, I wanted the same tent that I got from REI and this is exact the same except the color. Have taken this to Alaska and Yellowstone, rain or shine its an awesome tent!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: STOKED!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely STOKED about this tent! I’ve used it three times since purchasing it. Twice camping in heavy winds - this thing is awesome! Can’t speak highly enough about the design and ease of use and quality of this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Gerrdan

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tent. I'm no expert buy it has been easy to setup and clean. We've camped several times with three of us very comfortabley.
customer_reviews.author: User !

customer_reviews.title: Boy Scout approved (not endorsed by BSA)
customer_reviews.text: Boy Scout Troop...used once a month on 3 day campouts, survived its first 3" downpour and all are dry. Boys love them! (May 2014) We are beginning to have problems with the vinyl windows on them...seem to be decaying or splitting open. Our boys take care of their gear and it does not go into storage wet so I can only assume there is a problem with the quality of the vinyl. We are contacting Alps to see what they can do. (Aug 2015)
customer_reviews.author: Formula400

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! Lots of room
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Lots of room, good zippers, good build quality, packs up nicely, a bit heavy but not more than other tents of this size.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This product has a cancer warning on the label
customer_reviews.text: This product has a cancer warning on the label. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Vadym

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Backpacking for 3 days on the Appalachian Trail, my 3 kids and I slept in this tent. Plenty of room for packs, gear, and 4 people! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the money. Wouldn't recommend for backpacking unless you divided the weight among others in your group. Plenty of room under vestibules for you shoes to stay dry. Two doors are handy. Plenty of room for four with gear. First time out we had a rain storm during the night. We woke up nice and dry. Quick and easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: hikerjohn

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great lite 4 person tent. Easy to setup, easy to take down. Light enought to take backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Clearwater

customer_reviews.title: Great tent and a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: The tent is easy to set up. Kept me dry and it didn’t sweat at all. Love the ventilation and vestibules. I bought the matching footprint and highly recommend that option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sets Up In 2 Minutes
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even read the directions. It's just two poles and some clips. Went right up no problem. With the rain cover, it slept at least twenty degrees warmer than the outside. Definitely love this tent!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Packs small, sets up huge.
customer_reviews.text: Great 4 person tent. Used it as a two person plus gear and had room to spare. light weight and compact considering its size when set up. Kept rain out without being treated in several decent Rocky Mountain thunder storms. The floor is a little thin, and although it didn't have any punctures I would definitely feel more comfortable with a footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Real easy to set up. The wife and I use this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: RICK S

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Love the cover that comes with it. Great material. Sturdy. Spacious
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Racer

customer_reviews.title: Flashflooding? Hail? Lightning? This tent has you covered.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this tent. The very first weekend we went camping with it, the weather was a delightful mixture of hail, thunderstorms, and constant rain. While this was not my idea of an optimal way to test out a new piece of camping hear, I was very satisfied with how the tent withstood the elements. The tent kept us dry, and did not fall apart. Neither did my sanity. Solid five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price. We use it for car camping and the size is perfect for two, with three small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: DavidH

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: The tent is fabulous for the price! It was more than spacious for my husband and I and out two kids. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: JAstra

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent!
customer_reviews.text: Just went camping and used this tent. Like other reviewers, I'd recommend getting a tarp underneath just to keep it clean. I didn't find this tent large at all. I prefer having more space in the tent, and I like the size of this tent as a 2-person tent.
customer_reviews.author: beforethebop

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up and take down and feels very ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely thrilled with this tent. Easy to put up and take down and feels very secure once it is put together. I bought this to replace an old 4-person tent as I was looking for one that had good ventilation but also included a rainfly that covered the entire tent. Not only was the rainfly exactly what I had envisioned but it connects to the ground far enough out that ventilation was never an issue. Additionally - and a pleasant surprise - this footprint is considerably more spacious than the 4-person tent I replaced. No complaints and truly satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: lost city

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Lynx 4-Person Tent
feature_bullets: There's no assembly frustration with our Lynx Tent series; this free-standing, aluminum two-pole design is a breeze to setup
Polyester tent fly resists water and UV damage while adding two vestibules for extra storage space
Fully equipped with #8 zippers, storage pockets, gear loft, stakes, guy ropes and two doorways
The ALPS Mountaineering Lynx Tent is on our best sellers list; it’s a must-have for your next adventure
Base Size: 7'6 x 8'6, Center Height: 52", Total Weight: 8 lbs. 10 oz., Minimum Weight: 7 lbs. 15 oz., Color: Clay/Rust

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
